intro: Cassia siamea var. puberula, commonly known as Siamese cassia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically odd-pinnate with small, oval leaflets. The plant produces yellow flowers in clustered inflorescences, followed by elongated, woody pods containing flat, brown seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
